bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, November 22, 1926

div1.p: Peabody has received Kelly's new edition of Walter Reed and Yellow Fever. He sends Kelly materials concerning pensions for Kissinger and the yellow fever commission widows.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, November 22, 1926

opener.dateline:
The Morris High School
166TH. ST. AND BOSTON ROAD
NEW YORK CITY
----o----
The Morris Service League
JAMES E. PEABODY
CHAIRMAN OF THE TEACHERS' COMMITTEE
Nov. 22, 1926.

div1.p:
The new book - “Walter Reed and
Yellow Fever” - has just come, and
I am as proud as I can be- es-
pecially of the inscription. Many
thanks.

I enclose some mimeo, material enc. 1; enc. 2
that I think will interest you,
and especially the letter from
Mrs. Kissinger. Will you please
forward the letter to Dr. William E.
Ritter, National Research Council,
Washington?

Our Biol. Ass'n. has sent $125.
to the Kissingers ($100 went today,
including $50 from Princeton friends)
Your generous contribution and
Dr. Ritters will make a total of
$210. Evidently the money is sorely
needed. The Ass'n. also appointed
a committee of five & appropriated
money to send a letter to every
member of the Senate & House.
We hope for publicity in News-
papers & magazines.

Won't you please suggest im-
Ac
Ki
provements in the letter to Senator
Watson?

With kindest regards to Mrs.
Kelly and those wonderfully in-
teresting children and grand-
children - (and to the snake!)
